intro: Rhodiola elongata, commonly known as the longstem rhodiola, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. It is known for its adaptability to harsh climates and is often found at high altitudes. Rhodiola elongata is also valued for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
